properties.title: WARM SPACES - Somersham & District Community Shop

properties.address: Anselm Avenue, Bury Saint Edmunds IP32 6JZ, UK
properties.description: A warm, welcoming, safe place with free hot drinks and biscuits. There is ample parking nearby, and there is a toilet available. No wifi but plug sockets available for people to charge phones. We will have board games and jigsaws and people are welcome to bring their own crafts. We have wool and knitting needles if people want to learn to knit
properties.title: WARM SPACES - St Georges Church

properties.address: Angel Hill, Bury Saint Edmunds IP33 1LS, UK
properties.description: The warm space is located in the diocesan library and is furnished with comfortable chairs, free tea and coffee, an opportunity to charge electronic devices and desks available for those wishing to work in a warm environment. There will also be board games and jigsaw puzzles available.
properties.title: WARM SPACES - St Edmundsbury Cathedral

properties.address: Needham Market Community Centre, School St, Needham Market, Ipswich IP6 8BB, UK
properties.description: This 'Chinwag' is aimed at those aged 60+ and is a pop in, where you are welcome to enjoy some refreshments and company but there will also be added entertainment (normally a singer).
properties.title: WARM SPACES - Chinwag - Needham Market

properties.address: Honey Hill , Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk IP33 1RT
properties.description: All welcome. We have a childrens area with toys, hot drinks, co-working desks and accessible toilets.
properties.title: WARM SPAcES - St Mary's Parish Church

properties.address: Stricklands Road, Stowmarket IP14 1AP, UK
properties.description: Offering a warm space with tea, coffee and soup with cheese roll. There is no charge just come along for a warm welcome.

properties.description: Monday (3rd of each month) - Flix in the Stix 1.30-5. Film and refreshments. Wednesdays - After school activities 3.30-5.30. Activities and refreshments. Thursdays - Coffee mornings 10-12. Refreshments

hours._text: 3rd Monday of the month 13.30 - 17.00 Wednesdays 15.30 - 17.30 Thursdays 10.00 - 12.00

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Robins Family Hub, Needham Market

properties.address: Finborough Road, Stowmarket IP14 1PN, UK
properties.description: Our clubhouse is offering a welcoming warm space on Monday and Tuesday mornings to anyone who might need it. Monday: 'Coffee and Company' 10.00 to12.00. Tuesday: 'Community Hub' for those with disabilities and dementia (and carers) and those who might need some company, 10.00 to 12.00. Soup and a roll alternate weeks.
properties.title: WARM SPACES - Rookery Bowling Club

properties.address: Woolpit Room Christian Fellowship - Woolpit Room, White Elm Road, Woolpit, Bury Saint Edmunds IP30 9SQ, UK
properties.description: Friendly Warm Space. Save on your own heating - come and enjoy free soup and a roll and some good company in the warm! Feel free to bring your knitting, games, puzzles etc. Help with transport available. (Warm Space funded with the help of Babergh/Mid Suffolk District Council).

hours._text: Fornightly on Fridays (next dates: Dec 2nd & 16th, Jan 6th & 20th) 12.00 - 16.00

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Woolpit Room

properties.address: Westgate Street, Bury Saint Edmunds IP33 1QR, UK
properties.description: "Theatre Royal is opening its doors for Toasty Tuesdays throughout the winter. If rising costs are causing concerns about staying warm at home this winter, we invite you to our Community Hub in our Café area at Theatre Royal. Everyone is welcome. We have hot food and drinks, wheelchair access with accessible toilets and device charging. We are also a child friendly space with buggy park and changing stations available."

hours._text: Tuesdays - 2022: 6th & 20th December 10.00 -12.30 2023: January: 3rd, 10th, 24th & 31st. February: 7th, 21st & 28th. March Dates: 7th. 10.00 - 12.30

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Theatre Royal Bury St Edmunds

properties.address: Consent Lane, Ipswich IP7 7SB, UK
properties.description: A friendly place to go in the warm where you can have a hot drink and something to eat at reasonable prices. All ages catered for. A variety of activities are provided - play cards or board games or just sit and read, or have a snooze, the choice is yours. On Wednesdays - Light lunches and afternoon teas, on Sundays - Breakfast snacks, cakes etc. (Warm Space supported by Babergh District Council Community Grants).

hours._text: Wednesdays 12.30 - 15.30 except 28th Dec) Sundays 10.00 - 12.00 (except 11th & 25th Dec and 1st Jan)

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Bildeston Sportsfield Pavilion

properties.address: Mill Lane, Woolpit, Bury Saint Edmunds IP30 9QX, UK
properties.description: Warm Space supported by Woolpit Good Neighbour Scheme who will provide hot drinks, squash, toast and biscuits. Table games, chats, socialising, magazines and newspapers available. Warm Spaces welcome everyone, young or old, it will be a pleasure to see you.
properties.title: WARM SPACES - Woolpit Village Institute

properties.description: Warm Space supported by Woolpit Good Neighbour Scheme who will provide hot drinks, squash, toast and biscuits. Table games, chats, socialising, magazines and newspapers available. Warm Spaces welcome everyone, young or old, it will be a pleasure to see you.

properties.description: "Free Soup and sandwich and hot drink available. Accompanied children welcome. Activities also available – jigsaws /colouring / chat. "

hours._text: Community Café: 10.00 - 15.00 Next date - 17th Dec then every third Saturday of the month from 21st Jan. Community Pub: 18.00 – 22.00 Next date – 2nd Dec then every fourth Friday of the month from 24th Jan.

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Cotton Village Hall

All welcome to both events. "
properties.title: WARM SPACES - Bildeston Baptist Church

properties.address: The Folly, Haughley, Stowmarket, Suffolk IP14 3NS, UK
properties.description: Friendly warm space open to all. Offering free Wifi, hot and cold refreshments, books, magazines, jigsaws and games. We also provide books, games, toys for children. Come along and enjoy a chat with a cuppa in the warm.
properties.title: WARM SPACES - The Green Room at Haughley Village Hall,

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Acton Village Hall

properties.address: Hitcham Village Hall, The Causeway, Hitcham, Ipswich IP7 7NE, UK
properties.description: Hitcham Village Hall has been awarded a Winter Warmth Support Grant from Babergh and Mid Suffolk District Council to support the Hitcham Hub Warm Welcome (HHWW) initiative which is providing a warm space with activities, hot & cold beverages with biscuits and for certain events, hot food, for the residents of Hitcham and surrounding parishes.

hours._text: Click on the website link to see the poster for the Warm Welcome events and times

properties.title: WARM SPACES - Hitcham Hub Warm Welcome

properties.address: Bury Road, Thorpe Morieux, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk IP30 0NR, UK
properties.description: Winter Warmer Coffee, Cake and Chat. The village hall will be open for an opportunity for all to meet over the winter months in a cosy place and enjoy hot drinks and cake. Please contact Jules on 07809 774404 or Mossy on 07940 811505 if you need a lift.

hours._text: Fortnightly on Mondays - Dates: December 5th & 19th - January 9th & 23rd - February 6th & 20th - March 6th & 20th - April 3rd & 17th 10.00 -12.00

properties.title: Warm Spaces - Thorpe Morieux Village Hall

properties.address: The Malthouse, Elyses Yard, Risbygate Street, Bury Saint Edmunds IP33 3AA, UK
properties.description: Free meal, warmth, company & entertainment for those alone, homeless or struggling financially. [Free transport for those in greater Norwich area leave message on 01603 510751 - option 1 and someone will return your request. http://www.norwichopenchristmas.org.uk/ Christmas Day lunch – Advance booking on 01284 754967 Food & Drink, music, election of games. A safe space with peer support and staff support throughout the day. Contact a member of staff if you would like to attend.
